title: At this point, it's very clear that we need a 4th keystone option for every path
body:
It's been 11 days since the new runes are here and is already very clear that a lot of champions simply doesn't fit well any keystones available right now:

 - The [Press the Attack] keystone doesn't fit well most of the old Fevor of Battle bruisers (with some exceptions of course, like Jax due to his mixed damage).

 - Some mages really miss the [Deathfire Touch] (DFT) and there's no equal or similar replacement for it in the Sorcery tree.

 - There's some champs that doesn't have any decent keystone option such as Nunu (that isn't better with others users of said keystone).

 - Some champs only have one decent keystone option and can't really choose their playstyle besides minor rune choices.

Creating an additional keystone for the paths that lacks some options would be easier to do, but it would be unfair. That's why i think that every path should have a 4th keystone. This is something that needs some urge, since most of those champions without fitting keystones lost a lot of winrate % and that created the situation of "Who else uses better the keystone wins".

I would go so far as to say Resolve needs to be split into two different trees.  One focused on Wardens/Beefy Enchanters (I want to be tanky and help my friends) and one focused on Vanguards/Juggs (I want to be tanky and hurt people).  I feel like Resolve is trying to pack too much stuff into one tree and as a result many of the options don't feel great.

Honestly the other trees are *mostly* fine, there are just a few Keystones that are too similar to each other (most notably Aery/Comet and Lethal Tempo/Press the Attack).  Those problems could be addressed by tweaking the functionality of the respective keystones a bit.

fearless in a way did make it in. Aftershock is a majorly buffed up version of it with a different conditional (Immobilizing effects vs damage taken). But how many "juggernauts" do you know who don't have an immobilizing effect?

Also, tying it to immobilizes is pretty smart. "damage taken" is a component which gives control of the passive to your enemy, who can just use a small poke to bring out and proc Fearless, and then you are on cooldown during the actual fight. Immobilize puts the power in YOUR hand, and even encourages you to do your job more: diving in, ccing, and sustaining the immediate damage, and it's FAR stronger than fearless; It's basically a 2.5 second "I am Sejuani's passive" passive with the added bonus of aoe damage based on HP. It may force you to play aggressively, but it certainly doesn't kill you if you're smart. An immobilize means that the opponents won't be able to prevent you from running. Maoki and Leona: you go in, Immobilize, and then you use other skills on your way out. It doesn't mean stay in a fight until dead.

I think the new keystone should mainly be for the old Fervor juggernaut users. They took that one for the extra AD it provided and nothing ells, as most juggernauts have excellent AD scaling. A new keystone should, in my opinion, at least give extra AD, combined with something that they maybe need.

My Idea for this could just be a Fervor type keystone that provides a % of your health as extra AD/AP adaptive whenever you deal damage with an ability or AA, with the addition that it will provide extra effects on certain health tresholds. Something like this;

Lust for battle: Whenever you deal damage with an ability or an AA against an enemy you get 1 stack of Lust of Battle, up to a maximum of 8 stacks. Each stack gives X% of your max health as extra AD or AP(adaptive). On 50% health each stack gives you X extra movement speed as well, and under 35% the bonuses are doubled.

This would not only be good for old Fervor Juggernauts, but could be used by other tanky fighter champions. Maybe a Swain, Signed or Vlad (champs that get a fair amount of extra health) might be able to use it as well as it gives AD/AP adaptive damage. And it would really fit well with the juggernaut role description of walking bulks of strength that will fight to the death.

Your suggestions sounds more something for a small rune then a keystone rune, as it just provides extra stats.

Wait why should it be for juggernut users when bruiser/fighter have been the best user of fervor? Riven, Camille, Yasuo, Jax, Renekton all were able to stack it pretty fast and could still keep fighting while their abilities were on cooldown. Every single one has AA resets, animation cancels etc to fully use it. 
Compared to juggernauts like yorick, nasus, darius who would take very long to actually use it. I don't say that juggers wouldn't use or couldnt use fervor but definitely not a new keystone based on fervor for juggers alone who didn't use it as good as fighters.

Most bruisers/fighters are doing fine with Press the Attack, as almost all of them have ways to reset their AA or have AS steriods and a good amount of them don't mind the 15% AS from it as well.

Jax/Irelia don't mind AS at all, and Jax has a AA reset as well
Renekton has his W as a reset and to apply 3 stacks quickly if enraged.
Camille has a reset in her Q
Fiora has a reset in her E
Yasuo Q counts as an AA

From all the bruisers/fighters, I think only Riven and Camille (maybe renekton as he doesn't really like AS) would benefit largely from a new Fervor type of keystone. The others are doing fine with Press the Attack, as their win-rate shows. A lot more of bruisers/fighters damage seems to come from their AA's then their abilities (Or their enhanced AA's), and so AS isn't a bad stat for them.

That's why i suggested a new fervor for juggernauts; Not because they were the main users, but because most of them that used it cannot really make good use of the new press the Attack and the rest of the precision tree.

And my suggestion wouldn't be exclusive for just juggernauts; Anyone that gets a decent amount of health could get some great value out of it, which includes champions like Renekton, Gnarr and Camille (three champions that build a decent amount of health, and all three have under 50% winrate as well).

You could just make it the old Fervor and put it in the precision tree giving flat AD per stack, but then you got to balance it for every AA user as well. Making it scale of health and putting it in the Resolve tree just makes more sense to me, as an aggressive keystone for the more tanky carries (including some bruisers/fighters, just not all of them).

But it was just a suggestion, and the core point i wanted to make is that a new juggernaut keystone (which Riot is thinking about) should provide flat AD for the old fervor juggernauts that used it.

This will forever be the problem of the new rune system, which I pointed out before it was even released, hell before they even released all of the runes.

You can't make a system which abstracts bonus power into mechanics and then somehow expect things to ever work without almost as many number of options as there are champions. 

The only way this system could be considered fair for each champion's balance, would be every rune existed as a side grade, rather than bonus power. However, every aspect of the game, including jungle monsters, CSing, towers, even item/stat values has been balanced around the existence of some out of game initial power bonus... which they removed... so they tried to shove it into the same system which would only work if it functioned as side grades...
We need a support resolve tree and a tank resolve tree. Because a large majority of the resolve tree feels like it's meant for supports which leaves much to be desired for tank and juggernauts.
Not surprised the rune/mastery merge turned out even more creatively limiting than before.

Which is explicitly why i was opposed to it as soon as they provided examples of the new system. 
This was obviously going to be the case from the start and it's just bad for the future of the game.

Nunu needs a VGU. Other than that there aren't really champions who suffer that much from the current variety of keystones. Ivern maybe... but he's a wacky guy anyways. The current keystones overall offer way more optimization than the previous masteries did.

Gp and Ezreal with Kleptomancy is kinda mandatory. Easy fix would be to reduce the gold income based on how often the effect has been proc'd in certain time window.
It's ok to have good champion/keystone interactions as long as the champion is not considerably weaker when picking alternatives.
